subject: AI & Agents
title: Positional Encoding: Tracking Word Order
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Positional Encoding: Tracking Word Order.

hook.text: 'Dog bites man' and 'man bites dog' use the same words. How does a transformer know the difference?

buildup.text: Transformers process all words simultaneously â€” unlike humans who read sequentially.

discovery.text: Positional encodings add a unique mathematical signature to each word based on its position.

twist.text: The original encodings used sine and cosine waves. Newer models learn positions during training.

climax.text: Without positional encoding, transformers would treat every sentence as a bag of unordered words.

punchline.text: Order matters. Even for machines that read everything at once.

quiz.question: Why do transformers need positional encoding?
options: They process all words at once and need to track word order
They can only read one word at a time
